attributes.action: end the "Right to Buy" Council Homes
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It has been the policy of the government since the Thatcher Era to allow people to buy their council houses. 

However the sale of housing stock has meant a severe shortage by those seeking to rent at reasonable rates. Instead they are paying inflated rent rates to fatcat landlords. 

It should be the policy of government that council stock remains in council hands for renting. It should fall to the private sector to build houses for purchase. 

More reasonable rates from councils and rental associations would allow individuals to build up deposits to use later in the purchase of a house should they so wish. 

Relying on the private sector to build houses would also ensure a more vibrant private market in this downturn. It would also mean there was housing available rather than relying on emergency hostel accomodation.
